intro: Bastardiopsis turumiquirensis, commonly known as the Turumiquirensis plant, is a rare flowering plant native to the Andes region of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible parts. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool temperatures and well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
